casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee v. Lucio SANTILLAN-GARZA, Defendant-Appellant. No. 09-40456

Conference Calendar.

United States Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. June 22, 2010. James Lee Turner, Assistant U.S. Attorney, U.S. Attorney’s Office, Houston, TX, for Plaintiff-Appellee. Marjorie A. Meyers, Federal Public Defender, Philip G. Gallagher, Federal Public Defender’s Office, Houston, TX, for Defendant-Appellant. Before JOLLY, STEWART, and OWEN, Circuit Judges. PER CURIAM: *

The Federal Public Defender appointed to represent Lucio Santillan-Garza has moved for leave to withdraw and has filed a brief in accordance with Anders v. California, 386 U.S. 738, 87 S.Ct. 1396, 18 L.Ed.2d 493 (1967). Santillan-Garza has not filed a response. Our independent review of the record and counsel’s brief discloses no nonfrivolous issue for appeal. Accordingly, counsel’s motion for leave to withdraw is GRANTED, counsel is excused from further responsibilities herein, and the APPEAL IS DISMISSED. See 5th Cir. R. 42.2.

Pursuant to 5th Cir. R. 47.5, the court has determined that this opinion should not be published and is not precedent except under the limited circumstances set forth in 5th Cir R. 47.5.4.
